alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 31 at 9:34PM CDT until May 31 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...RANDALL...WESTERN CARSON...WESTERN HUTCHINSON...POTTER AND MOORE COUNTIES... At 934 PM CDT, automated weather equipment reported severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Lake Meredith to 5 miles north of Washburn to 6 miles south of Canyon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment. At 923 PM CDT, automated weather equipment recorded a 60 mph wind gust 1 mile west northwest of Fritch. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Dumas, Canyon, Borger, Panhandle, Claude, Fritch, Sunray, Stinnett, Lake Tanglewood, Sanford, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Valley De Oro, Washburn, Umbarger, Palo Duro Canyon, Mescalero Park, Four Way and Masterson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Carson; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall
